content: * *Simon Chan** is a [Singaporean Chinese](/wiki/Chinese_Singaporeans) [Christian theologian](/wiki/Christian_theology) and ordained minister of the [Assemblies of God](/wiki/Assemblies_of_God). ## Biography Chan received his [M.Div.](/wiki/Master_of_Divinity) from [Asian Theological Seminary](/wiki/Asian_Theological_Seminary) and his [MTheol](/wiki/Master_of_Theology) in [Systematic Theology](/wiki/Systematic_theology) from [South East Asia Graduate School of Theology](/wiki/South_East_Asia_Graduate_School_of_Theology). He then completed his [Ph.D.](/wiki/Doctor_of_Philosophy) in [Historical Theology](/wiki/Historical_theology) from [Cambridge University](/wiki/University_of_Cambridge) Until 2016, Chan was the Earnest Lau Professor of [Systematic Theology](/wiki/Systematic_theology) and dean of studies at [Trinity Theological College, Singapore](/wiki/Trinity_Theological_College,_Singapore). From 1997 to 2013, he edited the seminary's Trinity Theological Journal. Since 2016, he has been the editor of the Asian Journal of Theology. ## Works - Chan, Simon (1997). *Man and Sin: An Independent-Study Textbook*. Springfield, MO: Global University System Berean.
